column4: hi, i have dapper , and want kvim, i try vim-part, last yzis , but nothing finish good, is some way to install vim as kde componnet ? (with compiling yzis i have problem with lib lua) , .... any ideas ??
if you use gvim why not use GNOME?
vim was not designed to do that. that's why the kvim project branched, they've got different development goals. vim is not aimed at being an embedable widget
